polished_script:
HOOK: A guy closing 100 deals a year just told me what he hates most about his job. [ON-SCREEN: 100 DEALS/YEAR]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You know that sick feeling when you see your CRM full of contacts you should've followed up with weeks ago? The guilt when a hot lead goes cold because you didn't make that third call? [ON-SCREEN: YOUR CRM RIGHT NOW] You tell yourself you'll get to it tomorrow, but tomorrow never comes, and your pipeline stays empty.
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: Well, Eithan Davidov just revealed the brutal truth about what separates closers from everyone else.

INSIGHT: Eithan runs one of the top teams in Queens â€” investment sales, residential, the whole game. [ON-SCREEN: EITHAN DAVIDOV] When I asked what separates closers from everyone else, he didn't say prospecting or negotiation. He said: "The fortune is in the follow-up. And as much as I wish it wasn't, it's the hardest part." [ON-SCREEN: "THE FORTUNE IS IN THE FOLLOW-UP"] Not the first call. Not the listing presentation. The third text. The fifth email. The call three months later when they're finally ready. [ON-SCREEN: 3RD TEXT, 5TH EMAIL] That's where deals live or die. And here's the thing â€” he HATES it too, but does it anyway.

REFRAME: If you're avoiding follow-up, you're not broken â€” you're normal. The difference is top producers built systems so it happens whether they feel like it or not. You can start this today.

CTA: "Open your CRM right now and tell me â€” how many people should you have followed up with last month?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---
